alert.note: Alert for Anchorage; Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 15 at 3:28AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...PERIODS OF LIGHT SNOW AND FREEZING RAIN LIKELY THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... Periods of light wintry precipitation are expected across the Anchorage Bowl and western Kenai Peninsula through Sunday morning. Mostly light snow is still expected for these areas, however periods of snow mixing with freezing rain are not out of the question. It is a borderline freezing rain sounding which introduces complexity into the precipitation-type forecast. Whether snow or freezing rain is the predominant precipitation type, any precipitation is expected to be light, with less than an inch of snow and a light glaze of ice expected. Overall, the best chance for precipitation will be this evening through early Sunday morning. For the latest forecast visit www.weather.gov/afc. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
